image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone in their hand, with a sports betting app open on the phone.

props.synopsis: For years, Australia’s de facto online gambling regulator has been based in the Northern Territory. Advocates say that’s a problem and are urging the next federal government to take action.

title.children: How six people in the NT regulate Australia's online gambling trade

image.altText: a person sitting on a rock looking at a grassy savanna

props.synopsis: The NT's Aboriginal sacred sites authority is investigating allegations of "interference with human remains" at a sacred site near a remote station in the Roper Gulf region.

title.children: Sacred sites authority investigating claims of NT burial site interference

image.altText: A police car blocking a road, with red tape across another road at the intersection. Three officers are also visible.

props.synopsis: Police have seized weapons including machetes and axes after a "large disturbance" in Katherine, during which an 18-year-old was allegedly struck by a vehicle.

title.children: Police seize machetes, axes after 'large disturbance' in Katherine

image.altText: A drone photo of a small ramp, with clear seas and lush greenery. The sky is blue.

props.synopsis: Marion Scrymgour has revealed the Northern Territory government and Commonwealth are a "long way" from resolving a funding dispute over the controversial Middle Arm industrial precinct outside of Darwin.

title.children: Federal MP casts doubt over future of billion-dollar Middle Arm project

image.altText: White cattle on red dirt stares at the camera with blue sky and low dry shrub in the background.

props.synopsis: Northern Australia's cattle industry is once again battling the government at the Federal Court, seeking compensation that reflects its losses from the export ban.

title.children: Cattle industry back in court chasing final payout for live export ban

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits on a couch with his right arm around a woman in a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Leah Pitman and Dustin Atkinson say failings at Northern Beaches Hospital caused the death of their newborn baby Harper. This is their harrowing and heartbreaking story.

title.children: Heartbroken parents detail failings that saw their baby die at Northern Beaches Hospital

image.altText: A cardboard box with survival products in it. A person's hand is reaching into the box.

props.synopsis: With war on their doorstep, Europeans have been warned to prepare survival kits with enough essentials to last them 72 hours, and Britain's leading disaster expert says the idea has been borrowed from Australia.

title.children: Europeans told to gather supplies for 72 hours amid 'direct' war threat

image.altText: A designed image showing a man with a moustache and beard on top of a yellow background showing a map of the seat of Reid.

props.synopsis: Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has endorsed a candidate to run in a battleground electorate who has been prohibited from providing health services as he "posed a risk to the health and safety of the public".

title.children: Trumpet of Patriots candidate bought PhD online

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia wears a black t-shirt and Chicago Bulls cap.

props.synopsis: A judge who ruled that Kilmar Abrego Garcia was wrongfully deported to El Salvador last month has slammed the Trump administration for doing "nothing" to facilitate his return.

title.children: Judge says Trump officials did 'nothing' to return wrongly deported man

image.altText: A close-up of a smartphone displaying an Nvidia logo, sandwiched between two computer parts.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has edged higher, while shares in Star Entertainment have faced choppy trade after their suspension ended. Nvidia shares fell after-hours on Wall Street. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nvidia faces $8.7b hit on China chip exports

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Zip shares leap on guidance update
BHP gets approval from NSW Government to extend mining at Mt Arthur Coal
China's economy beats growth forecasts but tariff hit dims outlook

image.altText: a graphic showing two dollar signs over a house in between two trees

props.synopsis: Young renters are feeling the stress of an unstable rental market and are putting off significant life plans as new data reveals most investment properties are sold within two years of being rented out.

title.children: Most investment properties sold within two years of being rented, study finds

image.altText: Peter Dutton with candidate Matt Moran

props.synopsis: Ute drivers have become a convenient hi-vis political icon for the Coalition but the increase in utes and SUVs in Australia outnumbers tradies as tax policies make buying big cars attractive.

title.children: Ute Man is a more complicated hero than the Coalition makes out

image.altText: Emil Petrov wears a black waterproof jacket over a cream coloured shirt and has brown rimmed glasses resting on his forehead.

props.synopsis: The family of Cindy Crossthwaite, who was shot dead in her Melbourne home in 2007, have expressed relief over the sentence, with the judge saying he considered Petrov was involved in a "joint criminal enterprise" to commit murder.

title.children: Emil Petrov sentenced to 26 years in jail for murdering estranged wife

image.altText: A man wearing a aussie yellow and gold shirt kissing a jar of vegemite

props.synopsis: Australian PM and cafe owner Leighton Walters say the dispute over the added vitamins in Vegemite is "rather odd" given Canada accepts shipments of UK's Marmite.

title.children: Australian PM backs cafe owner in Canada over Vegemite dispute with regulators

image.altText: A woman at a table

props.synopsis: Hospitality industry leaders fear it will become harder to fill their rosters as both major parties vow to reduce immigration levels if they win the federal election.

title.children: Restaurant industry spooked by vow to crack down on immigrant workers

image.altText: Luke Smith wearing a suit, smiling with his arms crossed while standing in Logan's council chambers.

props.synopsis: "Bitch with the glasses" and "Well f***en get on the team, bitch" were among comments picked up by corruption investigators probing Logan City Council, according to the court documents.

title.children: Crooked mayor's conversations caught on secret phone taps, court documents show

image.altText: woman with grey hair wearing large beads and a dark blue dress with black curtain behind her

props.synopsis: The ABC's inaugural Elder-in-residence, Professor Jackie Huggins, has come full circle after beginning at the broadcaster as a teenager and will now help lead responses to the Listen Loudly, Act Strongly report into racism.

title.children: The ABC's first Elder-in-residence wants to see a future without racism

image.altText: Aerial view of burning paper and smoke from a recycling plant fire.

props.synopsis: A recycling company and its former director are fined a combined total of $1.28 million for pollution caused by the 2017 fire at SKM's Coolaroo Recycling plant that burned for 10 days and caused hospitalisations.

title.children: Nearly $1.3m in fines over massive industrial fire in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone in their hand, with a sports betting app open on the phone.

props.synopsis: For years, Australia’s de facto online gambling regulator has been based in the Northern Territory. Advocates say that’s a problem and are urging the next federal government to take action.

title.children: Online gambling regulator chair admits accepting gifts from bookmakers

image.altText: Louise Hunt

props.synopsis: The death of the mother-of-two Louise Hunt has shocked the southern Queensland community of Toowoomba.

title.children: Alleged murder victim Louise Hunt remembered as 'exceptional human being'

image.altText: A screenshot of a video posted to social media showing Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: Protesters have ambushed Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at a hotel he was staying at, the latest incident in a series of disruptions that have plagued both sides of politics during the election campaign.

title.children: Albanese confronted by alt-right protesters at hotel, raising security fears

image.altText: A man stands in a street full of street art and graffiti holding a large drawn robot face over his own.

props.synopsis: Just like street art or graffiti, sticker art is sometimes maligned or misunderstood. In a bid to change that, Australia's growing number of sticker artists, along with their international peers, are showcasing their work in a Sydney expo.

title.children: When Roni realised she had 5,000 photos of stickers, she had to share them

image.altText: The back of a woman's head looking out a window into a garden

props.synopsis: Victorian senate candidate Jordan van den Lamb says he will consider an apology to a Victorian woman whose vacant property was occupied by squatters after he published the address online.

title.children: 'I'm not rich': Break-in victim calls out senate candidate's squatting campaign

image.altText: David Lee in black glasses and blue shirt on a suburban street with grass and houses

props.synopsis: While cost of living and housing are important issues to those in Greater Western Sydney, a key detail major parties will also need to address are the adverse effects of the region’s rapid population growth.

title.children: Why this Western Sydney commuter's drive to work has nearly tripled in duration

image.altText: A military plane on a runway.

props.synopsis: Moscow's relationship with Jakarta is in the spotlight, after a report claimed the Kremlin had asked to station war planes at an air base 1,200 kilometres from Darwin.

title.children: Russia 'working quietly' on Indonesia military ties before air base storm

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, standing above Donald Trump, spread his hands.

props.synopsis: The man who was named by Pete Hegseth in the Houthi leaked war group chat as the best staff point of contact for the National Security Council has been placed on administrative leave.

title.children: Top Pete Hegseth adviser put on leave in Pentagon leak probe

image.altText: A bird with a bright blue head, black eye banding, white belly and black and teal wing perched on a stick just off the ground.

props.synopsis: The complex songs of the tiny social bird could advertise whether it's a risk-taking explorer or a stay-at-home defender, and influence how it chooses a mate.

title.children: Adventurous or aggressive? Fairy-wren song reveals bird's personality

image.altText: Actress Cate Blanchett standing on the red carpet smiling

props.synopsis: The Australian-born Oscar-winning actress says there were many things she wanted to do with her life following the release of her latest major spy film, Black Bag.

title.children: Aussie star Cate Blanchett 'serious' about giving up acting

image.altText: Actor Gene Hackman with wife Betsy Arakawa

props.synopsis: A lengthy police investigation has revealed Betsy Arakawa was researching medical conditions relating to COVID-19 in the days leading up to her death.

title.children: Gene Hackman's wife researched her rodent-borne disease days before death

image.altText: Kangaroo road sign

props.synopsis: Police will allege in court that the man tied the kangaroo to the back of his car and dragged it from a property to the road, approximately 400 metres, while the animal was still alive.

title.children: Man charged with animal cruelty after kangaroo allegedly dragged by car

image.altText: Harris Andrews leads the Brisbane players out of the tunnel

props.synopsis: Chris Fagan doesn't believe the Brisbane Lions can keep getting away with playing from behind despite regularly overturning first-half deficits so far this season.

title.children: 'Not sustainable': Lions coach disturbed by reigning AFL premier's poor habit

image.altText: Ava and Deborah, dressed up, press their faces together in a photoshoot in Hacks.

props.synopsis: Hacks stars Jean Smart and Hannah Einbinder talk comedy's power to platform women in Hollywood beyond their looks, in a new series its creators call the "most autobiographical" yet.

title.children: 'Comedy is a protective measure': Hacks stars talk making TV under Trump
